<<<<<<< HEAD
Infant baptism plainly proved a discourse wherein certain select arguments for infant baptism, formerly syllogyistically handled, are now reviewed, abbreviated, and reduced to a plain method, for the benefit of the unlearned, and persons of weaker capacity / by Joseph Whiston ; with a large epistle to the pious and learned among the anti-pædobaptists, especially the authors of the late confession of their faith. Whiston, Joseph, d. 1690.
[8], 128 p.
Printed for Jonathan Robinson ..., London : 1678.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library. Errata: p. [8] Advertisement: p. 128.
=======

Whiston, Joseph, d. 1690.
[8], 128 p.
Printed for Jonathan Robinson ..., London : 1678.
